properties.name: American Institute of Graphic Arts (AIGA)
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 164 Fifth Avenue New York, NY 10010 AIGA, the professional association for design, is committed to furthering excellence in design as a broadly-defined discipline, strategic tool for business and cultural force. AIGA is the place design professionals turn to first to exchange ideas and information, participate in critical analysis and research and advance education and ethical practice. (AIGA website)

properties.name: Angelic Organics
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 1547 Rocton Road, Caledonia, IL 61011Community Supported Agriculture. Purchase a share and you get fresh, seasonal produce. John Peterson heads up this farm with a rich history. I learned all about it recently when I saw the documentary, "The Real Dirt on Farmer John". www.therealdirt.net The funny thing is I grew up about 8 miles from this place and never knew it existed. I recommend the movie.

properties.name: Ape Cave
properties.description: Posted by KbeadleMount St. HelensI took my mom to Ape Cave during the winter. We hiked a mile in the snow with our gear. We reached the entrance and she freaked. She started crying and telling me she would do anything else I wanted as long as we didn\'t go in that hole. I was annoyed, frustrated and pushed. No luck. So, we walked back in the rain and snow. As we drove off the car got stuck in snow. We sat for several hours during which time my mom peed on the tires thinking that would help melt the snow and free us from our misery. Eventually we dug ourselves out using a piece of plastic. A few years later my mom, her husband, my brother and I went back. My mom thought she was going to hang out in the car while we did our thing. This time we forced her in the hole (see photo). She lived to tell the tale.

properties.name: Apizza Scholls
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 4741 SE Hawthorne Blvd. PortlandFresh ingredients, no frills, crust that takes 24 hours to prepare. They often run out of crusts before they close. I would get the margherita pizza. No need for meat because the flavor is so good.

properties.name: Arm pit AKA Rockford, Illinois
properties.description: Posted by KbeadleI once lived here. I do believe it was rated the worst city to live in...more than once.

properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle  Great booth at the Beloit Farmer\'s Market. They sell fresh herbs and other good smelling stuff. No chemicals.

properties.name: Bartlett Museum
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 2149 St. Lawrence Ave., Beloit, WI, 53511When I was in 2nd grade our class took a trip to this Mid-1800s Victorian farmstead and one-room schoolhouse. We had to wear period clothing. My mom made my costume, of course. It had a matching long skirt, shawl and bonnet. Things I remember about the trip: - I was excited to pump water from the well - my cousin was working there and it surprised me - I got to drink a can of pop which my mom wrapped in aluminum foil to keep it cold

The early curriculum was built on the classical tradition, but students were given an unusual amount of freedom to choose their own courses. Today, Beloit is recognized for its longstanding commitment to curricular innovation, and its first-year initiatives and international education programs.

properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 2904 Northeast Alberta Street, Portland, OR, 97211Fried chicken and corn bread. The bar is cozy. I like getting the salad with fried chicken on top. They have mashed potatoes.

properties.name: Black Sheep Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 107 se Washington Street, Portland, Oregon 97214Today I went to one of the Black Sheep Bakery outlets http://blacksheepbakery.com/site/687531/page/474549 (Portland Farmers Market at PSU park blocks). I went early, got my coffee and promptly walked over to their booth for a carrot cupcake. Then I saw some sort of berry pastry. I don\'t know what it is called but I bought it (along with the carrot cupcake). This new berry pastry thing was really good. Really, really good and vegan. I guess I will have to arrive early next week to find out more. I don\'t know if they sell their goods at their headquarters. It may be you have to visit one of their outlets. I know they sell muffin and mix packages online and wholesale.

properties.name: Brat Days 2006 Festival
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle     Celebrate by eating brats! August 3 - 5, 2006 There website says: It all began in the 19th century when sausage found its way to Sheboygan through German Settlers. Over the years the ancient Roman tradition of cooking them over an open flame has been kept alive by the people of Sheboygan. Though no one will ever understand the phrase Ã¢ÂÂBrat FryÃ¢ÂÂ because they are grilled, brats continue to be the focal point of the community. The first festival was held in 1953 in downtown Sheboygan. Back then it was a common sight to see streets re-named Bratwurst Blvd., and Seemel-Strasse. Horse drawn wagons were also seen in the annual parade. After holding it for more than 13 years, the decision was made to cancel it because the crowds had gotten too big for the cityÃ¢ÂÂs downtown to handle. In 1978 the festival was revitalized! Brat dayÃ¢ÂÂs is the largest fundraiser for the Sheboygan Jaycees. All proceeds are given back to the community primarily through donations. Past organizations that have received donations include the Field of Dreams (Sheboygan Recreation Department), Above and Beyond ChildrenÃ¢ÂÂs Museum, Jaycee Quarryview Park, Big Brothers/Big Sisters, Area High School Scholarship Program, the American Red Cross and the American Cancer Society. This shows one of the many brat stands setup throughout downtown Sheboygan in the 1950\'s. At one time there were over 50 brat stands operated by different organizations and businesses.

properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 5901 Sw Corbett Ave, Portland, ORThe owners are from Green Bay, WI and you can tell by the amount of Packer paraphernalia. It sort of feels like a sconni bar, too. Fish and chips off all sorts (halibut, salmon, perch, walleye). Here is the catch...they are gluten free. They use rice four batter so it doesn\'t feel so heavy. They offer three different dipping sauces (be sure to ask for all three). For those of us wanting a Wisconsin Friday night fish fry give this place a try.

Our medical physicians perform cataract and laser surgery and other procedures and provide medical and surgical consultation. (website)

properties.name: Dog Mountain
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle Bingen, WAHiking dog mountain

properties.name: Donna & Toots
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 1631 NE Alberta Street, Portland, ORLocal designer\'s shop. I got my lovely pink ruffly scarf there and one of my favorite (best fitting) shirts with vintage pattern. They design and construct the clothing there. Sweet little shop. Here is what their website says: donna and toots is named after my eccentric and fashionable grandmother and great aunt. A trip to their numerous walk-in closets filled to the brim with such items as leopard-printed trousers, pink Chanel suits and red vinyl galore could curl anybody\'s toes. Together they were trouble, throwing elegant dinner parties and the occasional soiree. They were a huge impact on a little girl whose imagination had a hard time keeping up with their antics. I have studied fashion design in New York and London, along with having worked in San Francisco for a women\'s clothing designer. For the past two and half years I have been designing, manufacturing, and retailing my own designs. I love to borrow styles from the past - the 50\'s and the 60\'s - but don\'t put it past me to throw a modern curve.

properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle1717 Broadway St., Portland, OR 97232This place has been around since 1924 and it is darn good. They have wedding cakes, pies, breads, sweets...yum. Since I am not allowed to eat all of these sweets I simply get a powdered sugar cake donut. Then I stroll down to Halo and look at shoes.

properties.name: Hillsdale Library
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle  1525 S.W. Sunset Boulevard, Portland, OR 97239This is library location is a green building. Here is what their website say: Hillsdale Library was awarded Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED™) Gold certification in 2004. LEED™ is a national rating system and accreditation tool used to develop high performance, sustainable buildings. Buildings are awarded points and achieve a certain level of certification based on project procedures and design elements that are indicators of a "green building." The library, opened in March 2004, was the first Multnomah County building to receive LEED™ certification, a goal established by Multnomah County officials when they approved the construction of the building. The City of Portland has adopted LEED™ as the basis of design for all of its new construction. As a green building, Hillsdale Library offers many benefits, including: environmental protection (reduced air and water pollution, reduction in solid waste creation, and minimized depletion of natural resources); economic advantages (reduced operating costs and optimized economic performance over the life of the building); and health and safety benefits (better indoor air quality, decreased harmful pollutants indoors and out, and increased personal satisfaction). To achieve LEED™ certification, Hillsdale Library incorporates many environmental design elements that significantly reduce or eliminate the building\'s negative impact on the environment, while providing an inviting, friendly and comfortable place for library users of all ages.

properties.name: Home of the Green Bay Packers
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle   1265 Lombardi Avenue, Green Bay, WI 54304If you are from Wisconsin you are either a Packer fan or you know Packer fans. Of course you don\'t have to be from Wisconsin to like the Packers. Packer fans are loyal and a little nutty. They sit in freezing weather in droves even when the team is not doing so hot. Once I came home to find my mom\'s husband sitting alone in a dark house. He was wearing his GB sweatshirt while watching the Sunday game. I think that best defines a Packer fan.

properties.name: Hummingbirds
properties.description: Posted by KbeadleWhile walking around the tennis courts you can often hear and see hummingbirds. I believe they are resident birds.

properties.name: I want to be a cowboy
properties.description: Posted by KbeadleThis is the general area where my Mom decided she wanted to be a cowboy. She told us to leave her there with the cattle rustlers. I can only guess that she found herself in Wyoming. She did end up buying a cowboy hat in Cody.

properties.name: Identify the Condiments Game
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 3704 SE 16th Ave, Portland, ORI rarely use my kitchen yet my refrigerator door is filled with condiments that are well past their prime. Can you name them all?

properties.name: InnovaTek Inc.
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle  350 Hills Street, Suite 104, Richland, Washington 99354-5511 USAInnovaTek is a convergence of scientists, engineers and business professionals who are also humanitarians, dedicated to discovering better solutions for the world we live in. But we don\'t just search for solutions-we create them by converting unique ideas into workable hardware, and evaluating it again and again to ensure we are making the best decision in the development of our products. Because when it comes to advanced science and technology, the first answer is not always the best answer. And at InnovaTek, we want to deliver the best possible solution. For the people. For the planet. Our objective is simple: To help sustain our natural resources and enhance our quality of life.

They have mac and cheese, oyster shooters, wine, beer, cocktails, and desserts. They are open late (4am Fri-Sat). This has been a standby whenever folks come to visit from out of town. properties.name: Mai Thai
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle  1126 SW 18th Ave., Portland, Oregon 97205This is located in the old Couvron spot. I went here recently for the first time and got take-out. The staff were very, very friendly and helpful. I had the green curry with chicken and pad kra pao with shrimp. Both were fresh and tasty. I liked that the green curry was not overly soupy with coconut milk. The prices are reasonable. They offer delivery (fee), changing specials and FREE salad or egg rolls with take-out (5 minimum). Did I mention they were friendly? (503) 227-2161

properties.name: Mickey's Dairy Bar
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 1511 Monroe Street, Madison, WI 53711This is the place to get breakfast with a chocolate shake when you are hung over. Sit at the counter or a booth. yum. It is located across from the stadium. Artist Kathy Armstrong made a watercolor of the place.

properties.name: Milne Construction
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 6420 SW Macadam, Suite 300, Portland, Oregon 97239Milne Construction Co., founded in 1953, has constructed more than 850 memorial structures throughout the United States, Canada, and Australia. Milne Construction Co. began building in Australia in 1994. Many projects were done for customers who already had a Milne building. In addition to mausoleum construction services, Milne also provides cemetery master planning services, design services separate from construction, construction management services, and construction of other types of cemetery buildings such as offices, funeral chapels, and columbariums (for cremation niches). Check out their website and view the diverse project photos.

properties.name: Mom's Pies
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle  Milepost 35 1/2, McKenzie Hwy 126, Vida, ORThis is the place to get homemade, hand-rolled fruit pies made from scratch. I have stopped here many times after a day of kayaking on the McKenzie river. They serve soups, burgers and sandwhiches made from homemade bread. Check it out. It is located 45 miles east of Eugene on 126. I don\'t think they take cards.

properties.name: Motel Gallery

Motel is committed to housing the freshest in emerging art, showcasing up and coming artists from around the U.S. and specializing in editions and products made by and in collaboration with gallery artists.

properties.name: Mount Rushmore

properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle   Let your dog run free in this enclosed off-leash area.

I LOVE THE LIBRARY SO SHOULD YOU

properties.name: Myles' Teddywedgers Cornish Pasty
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 101 State Street, Madison, WI 53703If you like pasty then you should check this place out. The owner grew up in Mineral Point, WI were the miners ate it on a regular basis. I grew up with my Great Gram making pasty but I have never liked it. I find it to be too dry.

properties.name: National Indian Child Welfare Association (NICWA)
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 5100 SW Macadam Avenue, Suite 300, Portland, OR 97239The National Indian Child Welfare Association (NICWA) is the most comprehensive source of information on American Indian child welfare and works on behalf of Indian children and families. NICWA provides public policy, research, and advocacy; information and training on Indian child welfare; and community development services to a broad national audience including tribal governments and programs, state child welfare agencies, and other organizations, agencies, and professionals interested in the field of Indian child welfare. NICWA works to address the issues of child abuse and neglect through training, research, public policy, and grassroots community development. NICWA also works to support compliance with the Indian Child Welfare Act of 1978. This act seeks to keep American Indian children with American Indian families. (website)

properties.name: Northwest Anesthesia Physicians P.C.
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 1255 Hilyard Street, Eugene, OR 97401Northwest Anesthesia Physicians, P.C. has a professional staff composed of anesthesiologists and certified registered nurse anesthetists (CRNAs). An anesthesiologist is a medical doctor (physician) who has completed a post graduate residency in anesthesiology. A CRNA is a registered nurse with additional years of anesthesia specialty training.

properties.name: Nostrana
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 1401 Southeast Morrison Street, Portland, OR, 97214Get the wood-fired Margherita with Arugula pizza. The crusts are thin and chewy. They make their own sausage. They don\'t slop on a bunch of crappy ingredients. I typically go a little later to avoid waiting and crowds.

properties.name: Oak Creek Canyon
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle  SedonaLast week I went here to camp but the day before a forest fire kicked up. It was started by a camp fire. They evacuated over 400 people from the area. I think they are still fighting the fire. They have since closed the entire Coconino National Forest.

properties.name: One With Heart
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 4231 SE Hawthorne Blvd., Portland, OR 97215Yoga, pilates, kickboxing, weight training and martial arts studio. They have a kids after school program. www.onewithheart.com

properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle   1067 NE Columbia Blvd, Portland, OR 97211Adopt a pet. The shelter is bright, clean and a refreshingly possitive place to find a new pet. Often animal shelters can be a downer to visit but this place rocks.

properties.name: Outside In
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle   1132 SW 13th Ave, Portland, OR 97205-1703Outside In is a social service agency dedicated to serving low-income adults and homeless youth. It began in 1968, and has continually revised services to meet changing client needs. Current programs include a community health clinic, a homeless youth program designed to help homeless youth obtain independent living, and risk education. (website) Donate or volunteer.

properties.name: PDX Super Crafty
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle PortlandLocal PDX crafters published a book so we can all get crafty.

properties.name: Panorama Point County Park
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle   Hood River ValleyNice views of Hood River Valley and Mt. Hood

properties.name: Pawsitively Clean
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 3962 D SE Hawthorne Blvd., Portland, OR 97214Self-serve pet wash. They offer discounts to dogs in public service. 10th clean is free. They are friendly and helpful. Say hello to Joey the resident African Grey Parrot (he barks and makes street sounds). My dog does not smell now.

properties.name: Petrified Forest National Park
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle  Petrified Forest, AZThis is one of two family vacations we took. We drove down in the brown Dodge Charger and we ate McDonalds the whole way (my dad got a pickle stuck up his nose). I was eight. I was going to visit my Grandpa and see real live roadrunners. My parents divorced soon after.

properties.name: Point Reyes National Seashore
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle   Point Reyes National Seashore contains unique elements of biological and historical interest in a spectacularly scenic panorama of thunderous ocean breakers, open grasslands, bushy hillsides and forested ridges. Native land mammals number about 37 species and marine mammals augment this total by another dozen species. The biological diversity stems from a favorable location in the middle of California and the natural occurrence of many distinct habitats. Nearly 20% of the State\'s flowering plant species are represented on the peninsula and over 45% of the bird species in North America have been sighted. The Point Reyes National Seashore was established by President John F. Kennedy on September 13, 1962.

properties.name: Portland Community College - Cascade Campus
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 705 N. Killingsworth St. Portland, OR 97217The Cascade Campus is situated in the revitalized North Portland area, offering students a centralized location and a growing list of academic programs. It is a developing urban campus, located in the heart of a historic neighborhood, and is the home of such annual festivities as the PCC Mardi Gras celebration and the Cascade Festival of African Films. Easily accessed from Interstate 5, the campus enjoys a culturally rich landscape, featuring an exciting atmosphere of expanding academic services and campus facilities. PCC purchased the land and facilities of the campus from a defunct four-year Christian college called Cascade College in the late 1960s and the new campus opened in the fall of 1971. Ever since, the Cascade Campus has become a focal point for rebirth in the neighborhood and serves local residents with needed job training, college transfer and self-improvement courses. Numerous community programs like childcare, legal aid, neighborhood associations and job referral services are located either on the campus or within easy reach of it. In addition to its traditional academic programs, Cascade also is the home of the Skill Center, which gives people of all ages a chance to learn basic education to start a new life. Cascade serves over 14,000 students each year under campus president Algie Gatewood. (PCC website)

properties.name: Portland Community College - Cascade Campus
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 705 N Killingsworth, Portland, OR 97217 The Cascade Campus is situated in the revitalized North Portland area, offering students a centralized location and a growing list of academic programs. It is a developing urban campus, located in the heart of a historic neighborhood, and is the home of such annual festivities as the PCC Mardi Gras celebration and the Cascade Festival of African Films. Easily accessed from Interstate 5, the campus enjoys a culturally rich landscape, featuring an exciting atmosphere of expanding academic services and campus facilities.

properties.name: Portland Community College - Rock Creek Campus
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 17705 NW Springville Rd., Portland, OR 97229 The Rock Creek Campus is situated about 12 miles west of downtown Portland, in the rapidly growing Beaverton-Hillsboro area of Washington County. The campus\' concrete and wood structures fit nicely into the rolling hill farmland, creating a pristine study environment. Spacious, open malls highlight Rock Creek, which opened in 1976. The land for this scenic oasis was purchased in 1969 for 84,955 and has provided a great return on Portland Community College\'s investment, offering important educational services to a rural-suburban community.

properties.name: Portland Community College - Southeast Center
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle2305 SE 82nd and Division, Portland, OR 97216 The Southeast Center houses the college’s alternative high school program, Gateway to College, English as a Second Language, plus a variety of non-credit courses through the Community Education program. A dance studio, fitness center, ceramics and painting studios and a photography darkroom are available to students. The center also serves as headquarters for PCC’s Extended Learning Campus, which offers a wide array of workforce training, adult basic education, personal interest and continuing education programs.

properties.name: Portland Community College - Sylvania Campus
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 12000 SW 49th Ave., Portland, OR 97219 The Sylvania Campus is located in suburban Southwest Portland between Lake Oswego and Tigard. The campus opened in 1968 and rests on a gently sloping hillside, bordered by a forest of Douglas firs, oaks, maples and alders. It offers breathtaking views of Tualatin Valley, Bull Mountain and the Oregon Coast Range. Since its inception, the Sylvania Campus has become a complete and dynamic branch of the PCC experience. The cornerstones of the campus are the library and performing arts center, which were built in 1994. The library features the latest in learning resources while the nearby performing arts center is a fully equipped theater and dance venue.

properties.name: Ruby Violet
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 2641 NE Alberta St, Portland, OR 97211I went there recently for the first time. I got a massage and it was so relaxing. I have had plenty of massages and this one stands out as one of the best.

properties.name: Seafood + Wine Festival
properties.description: Posted by KbeadleAn annual thing organized by some friends. You hang out and drink wine either in a tent or out back with the smokers near the toilets. You eat crab melts and meat on a stick.

properties.name: Sears, Roebuck modeling debut
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle  The photographer asked me to "do something like a model would do." So I slid my arm from my side up to my waist, never changing my expression. Click on the photo below to read the copy.

properties.name: Sellwood Pool
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle   7951 SE 7th Avenue, Portland, OregonNeighborhood pool with tons of kids and moms. They sell snow cones in the park. Get there by bike via the Springwater Trail.

properties.name: Shanghai AKA Stinker
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle3704 SE 16th Ave, Portland, ORI am not a cat person. However, one day I heard this tiny sound coming from a bush. I looked and saw a dirty, tiny kitty. She weighed less than a pound, had ear mites and stunk. I brought her home and made a poop box out of a cereal box filled with vermiculite. She got out the next day while I was at work. I came home and searched while crying. Then I heard a tiny meow. She had been shanghaied by our neighbor and left in their garage. I stormed over there set her free. She has lived with me for nearly ten years. I am a Shanghai person.

properties.name: Shell station - where they pumped gas INSIDE my car
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle1525 SE Ladd Ave, Portland, OR 97214Last week I went here to fill up my gas tank. I gave the attendant my card. Then I heard him flailing about and swearing. Next thing I know the gas nozzle is pointing in my car with gas full on pumping. No one has heard of this ever happening. What a pain.

properties.name: Shopiere Falls - Sweet Allyn Park
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle  7149 S. County Trunk Hwy. J, Shopiere, WI 53511This is where I swam as a kid. There used to be a water fall I would jump off it has since collapsed. There was a cave under the falls I swam into. I caught a soft shell turtle and took it home. When it died. I buried it in our yard in a mason jar filled with water.

properties.name: Sluts - A piece of graffiti
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle I stood there looking out at the lovely Seattle Sound vista. Then I looked down and I was pleasantly surprised.

properties.name: Smith Rock State Park
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle  I don\'t rock climb but my friend does. This is a regular haunt for her and many other folks from Portland. We stopped on the way to Bend. It really is something.

properties.name: Talcott Free Library District
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle  101 East Main Street, Rockton, IL 61072The Talcott Free Library District provides current materials in a variety of formats, preserves local history, supports educational endeavors, and supplies community information. Fun place for kids to read and play. I took my one year old nephew there to play with colorful toys and hand puppets. Great staff and free wifi. What more could you ask for?

properties.name: Tea Rific Bento
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle   6661 SE Milwaukie Ave, Portland, Oregon 97202This bento is tasty. The veggie/chicken combo is hearty. They use quality chicken breast. You will see people in line daily. There is one picnic table.

properties.name: The Shock Doc Show
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle  "Gasp in amazement as The Shock Doc runs a blowtorch across his body and uses his mind to bend nails and break glass!" He escapes from a straightjacket while his head is wrapped in saran wrap. He drinks Windex. He eats glass. He is an actual medical doctor by day. What more can I say? Sideshow and Mentalism acts.

properties.name: The Superficial
properties.description: Posted by KbeadleThis is a place on the World Wide Web I go to when I need a quick fix. They make fun.

properties.name: The Whole 9 Yards
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 1820 East Burnside St., Portland, ORAnother fabric store for all your fabric and sewing needs. PDX seems to have an endless supply of fabric stores.

properties.name: Tilley's Pizza House
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 902 4th Street, Beloit, WI, 53511Tilley\'s Pizza House 608-362-0241 Grew up on this greasy, salty pizza. Yum.

properties.name: Todd Elementary School
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle  1621 Oakwood Avenue, Beloit, WI 53511My grade school. In kindergarten I used to collect box elder bugs and stuff them into my pockets. I fell in love with ice cream socials at this school. I once went alone and had a photo taken of myself sitting at a school desk while wearing a sweat suit.

properties.name: Urban frog symphony #1
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle PortlandWhen I stand here on quiet nights I hear a symphony of frogs croaking. I think they are coming from Oaks Bottom. http://www.platial.com/place/33459

properties.name: Urban frog symphony #2
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle PortlandWhen I get out of a movie at Laurelhurst I hear a symphony of frogs croaking. I think they reside in playing fields behind the school.

properties.name: Urban glacier
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle3031 SE Powell Blvd, Portland, OR 97202There is a parking lot located under the bowling alley on SE Powell. From there the sounds of rolling bowling balls and crashing pins remind me of tumbling boulders as they roll around a glacier. The muted thunder is comforting.

properties.name: WORLD'S TALLEST BUILDING...until 1996
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle233 South Wacker Drive, Chicago, Illinois 60606My Dad was a Sear\'s lifer and worked on the 34th floor when their corporate office was located in Chicago. Then they moved out to a bean field "campus" where Casual Fridays became big news. Kmart now owns Sears. Sheesh.

properties.name: Westmoreland True Value Hardware
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 6505 SE Milwaukie Avenue, Portland OR 97202 I like going to this neighborhood hardware store. I like that when I walk in there is always someone at the door ready to help you. I don\'t care if things cost a little more than Home Depot because that place exhausts me and you never get good help. They are open every day.

properties.name: Where I saw a bear
properties.description: Posted by KbeadleWhile backpacking around Mt. Rainer I saw one bear. The only bear I have seen in the wild. I have never seen a whale. Never.

properties.name: Where I saw a mountain lion
properties.description: Posted by KbeadleAfter hiking at Tumalo State Park this summer I saw a mountian lion cross the road. I was in the car but it was an amazing sight. It was all muscle and didn\'t care one bit about us. It had a huge tail. Still no whales.

properties.name: Where my new estate sale Pendleton cape airs out
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle3704 SE 16th Ave, Portland, ORNot too musty

properties.name: Where my new estate sale pot holders hang on the refrigerator
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle3704 SE 16th Ave, Portland, ORfunctional art

properties.name: Where the air smells of Fruit Loops
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle3704 SE 16th Ave, Portland, ORSweet smell of Fruit Loops fills your nose thanks to many blooming Winter Daphne plants.

properties.name: Windsor Solutions, Inc.
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle  4000 Kruse Way Place, Building 2, Suite 285, Lake Oswego, OR 97035Windsor Solutions, Inc. provides custom information solutions for environmental, natural resource + health systems. Windsor Solutions is an IT consulting firm that provides industry-specific information systems for environmental and government agencies. Because we specialize in these areas, our business knowledge and our technical expertise allow us to develop and implement solutions that address your agency’s specific needs in regard to critical data points, appropriate analysis, and information sharing. We focus on these disciplines: Air, Land, Water, Natural Resources, Health, Cross-discipline

properties.name: Wisconsin Memorial Union Terrace
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle 800 Langdon Street , Madison, WI 53706Hang out, listen to music, drink beer, sit it sunburst chairs

properties.name: Wisconsin State Capitol
properties.description: Posted by KbeadleLooks like the US capitol building, only smaller

properties.name: Women's East Bay Hiking Group
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle    605 Baywood Roadm, Alameda, California 94502Go to their website to view great photos of past trips and to get their hiking schedule. Here is what they say: The Women\'s East Bay (WEB) Hiking Group is an informal group of diverse women who enjoy exploring the great outdoors and the fabulous natural resources available here in the San Francisco East Bay and beyond. We are led by Lu Lothrop of Alameda, who lends a wealth of expertise and limitless enthusiasm to the group. Women of all ages and levels of hiking experience are encouraged to join us for fun, fellowship, and fitness. You may drop-in or sign up for a series of hikes. Membership is a great option with lots of benefits, but is not required.

properties.name: p:ear
properties.description: Posted by Kbeadle   809 SW Alder, Portland, Oregon 97205p:ear builds positive relationships with homeless and transitional youth, ages 15-23, through education, art and recreation to affirm personal worth and create more meaningful and healthier lives. (website) Make a donation, volunteer and visit their gallery.
